Position Summary: This position is primarily responsible for ensuring Senior Management is aware of any/all operational risks related to IT security. You will be responsible for assessing, designing and providing implementation oversight of operationally sustainable IT security and compliance roadmaps, processes and controls. You must possess technical and IT security domain expertise and strong business acumen to ensure that solutions balance business needs with IT security requirements.Duties and Responsibilities: 

Be a thought leader throughout the company in regards to IT security best practices
Monitor changes or advancements in emerging technologies to gain competitive advantage within the IT security domain
Develop and deliver sustainable IT security and compliance strategic roadmaps with clearly defined milestones and objectives that will mature 407 ETR's operations and reduce risk and exposure based on the data security and compliance framework
Oversee the creation and management of annual operating and capital budgets for IT Security
Work with key members of the Corporate Security Group to build and maintain a data security and compliance framework, clearly documenting data classifications and associated security and compliance requirements
Act as chair of the cross-functional Corporate Security Group, ensuring that the group mandate, meeting agendas and action items are documented, communicated, and completed
Liaise directly with Shareholders to develop Security best practices, frameworks, reporting standards, and Shareholder Security Committees to ensure consistency globally, across concessions and assets.
Develop business metrics to measure the effectiveness of the IT security and compliance program, and increase the maturity of the program over time
Prepare and deliver security and compliance program updates and awareness sessions to an array of stakeholders including but not limited to the Board of Directors, Senior Management, Leadership, and IT Teams
Ensure appropriate programs are in place to attract, retain, and develop key personnel within IT Security
Manage full-time and contract IT Security team members in addition to external partners providing IT security services
Design, measure, monitor, assess, and enhance system and network IT security processes and controls covering in conjunction with relevant stakeholders; control areas include but are not limited to security monitoring and incident response, threat intelligence, malware management, vulnerability management, identity and access management, secure development, information protection, governance and compliance, vendor risk management, and business continuity
Oversee the IT Security Incident Response processes, coordinate security incidents investigations and representing IT on the corporate Breach Response Team
Work closely with key stakeholders throughout the development and execution of new projects, backlog items and service requests to ensure that corporate information security objectives, including Secure System Development lifecycle adherence, are maintained
Oversee the creation and maintenance of IT Security-related policies, standards, baselines, guidelines and procedures, ensuring alignment with designated security frameworks
Oversee vulnerability audits, assessments and associated remediation activities to ensure systems are configured in accordance with established policy, best practice guidelines and designated compliance frameworks
Work closely with the Corporate Security Group, Internal Audit and other audit stakeholders to ensure the audit of these areas is comprehensive while taking accountability for the coordination of all IT Audit-related activities
Manage the IT Risk Register and associated remediation activities
Oversee the testing of the IT Security Incident Response process
Oversee and report on the annual IT Security Risk Assessment and ongoing System Control Assessment processes
Assist with the maintenance and testing of the IT Infrastructure Disaster Recovery Plan

Minimum of 8 years of IT security related work experience required
College Diploma or University Degree in Computer Engineering or Computer Science required
One or more of the following certifications required:
CompTIA Security+
GIAC Information Security Fundamentals

Experience in designing or redesigning best lean, practice-based IT security processes in a dynamic fast-moving organization required
Experience in management of Vulnerability Assessments and IT Security Audits required
Working knowledge of software development practices and languages, including Secure Development Lifecycle practices
Understanding of IT security and compliance-related vendor requirements, including but not limited to procurement, legal and operational considerations
Understanding of networking, operating system, compute / storage, cloud, and application technology design and security related best practices

Summary407 ETR's Information Technology division is responsible for the infrastructure and software to enable the efficient operation of the highway-including toll capture, account management, financials, and data storage/analytics-as well as customer services including call-center, web, IVR and supporting workflows.Delivery is accomplished using an Agile-Scrum approach, including self-organization, short iterations, strong collaboration, and dedicated teams in scrum rooms.At 407, all developers meet weekly to briefly hear updates from management, then break off into multiple learning streams. Topics include Cloud, Best Practices in Java, Data Streaming, SalesForce and Data Science. Some weeks, the streams are very hands-on (i.e. getting AWS.CLI up and running, playing with Kubernetes, learning Python). The developer led topics range from a learning above a wide variety of topics (i.e. Cloud, Best Practices in Java, Data Streaming, SalesForce, Data Science...).About 407ETRHighway 407 ETR is an all-electronic open-access toll highway located in the Greater Toronto Area. The highway spans 108 kilometres from Burlington in the west to Pickering in the east.On Highway 407 ETR, we offer peace of mind and a fast, safe and reliable trip. That’s why millions of drivers rely on Highway 407 ETR to get around the GTA. Every driver we serve is one less vehicle on a congested alternate route, giving drivers more time for the things that matter most.407 International Inc. is the sole shareholder of 407 ETR and is owned by:

Canada Pension Plan Investment Board (CPP Investments) through indirectly-owned subsidiaries (50.01%);
Cintra Global S.E. which is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Ferrovial S.A. (43.23%); and
SNC-Lavalin (6.76%).

   Job Description
 


 This remote position will be located in the Greater Vancouver area



   What you'll be doing
 


   You’ll be joining CIBC’s Information Security team. You’ll be on the front lines of building the future of information security at CIBC. As an Information Security Consultant, you’ll assess projects for security risks and present recommendations that allow the business to make informed conclusions. You’ll provide insight and support to assemble policies and procedures that safeguard our clients, enhance risk management, and enable our success.
 


   How you'll succeed
 



     Security assessments – Leverage your expertise in Information Security Management to prepare and conduct assessments for both planned initiatives and unplanned instances. Perform clear and thorough threat and vulnerability scans of internal and external devices. Use your knowledge of processes, tools, techniques, and practices for assuring consistency to standards associated with accessing, altering, and protecting organizational data.
   


     Risk reviews – Examine and interpret requirement documents and architecture diagrams. Collaborate with senior leaders and make informed, risk-based recommendations to enhance information system security. Weigh business needs against security concerns to help guide the business to make practical and informed risk choices.
   


     Governance support – Proactively contribute to governance initiatives, providing technical and business advice, as well as insight on management processes. Contribute to the development of governance and risk-related company policies.
   



   Who you are
 



     You know that details matter. You notice things that others don't. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
   


     You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information. You communicate detailed information in a meaningful way.
   


     You’re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
   


     You have a degree/diploma in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. You have at least five years of experience as an Information Security Consultant or a similar role.
   


     You’re a certified professional. It’s an asset if you have your CISSP, CIA, or CISM designation.
   


     Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.
   



   What CIBC offers
 


   At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.
 



     We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program
   


     Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients
   


     We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development

JOB SUMMARY
The position is responsible for the identification of potential clinical events, as well as the collection, review and preparation of required documentation for review by clinical event or adjudication committees.  MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES

Obtain, review, and process Investigator Record of Potential Endpoint / Event forms from Investigator sites in hard copy or within electronic environment.
Follow-up with Investigator sites to obtain additional supporting documentation and materials for potential endpoints or events.
Review medical information via hard copy or within an electronic environment to ensure completeness of endpoint or event package, to redact patient-specific protected information, and to identify any unreported potential endpoints or events.
Review Adverse Event (AE) / Serious Adverse Event (SAE) and other data listings and provide appropriate follow-up with the Investigator site to ensure that all potential endpoints or events have been reported.
Prepare and distribute endpoint or event documentation packets and materials for Clinical Events Committee review.
Assist with preparation for periodic Clinical Events Committee meetings.
Resolve event-related queries of Clinical data, as needed.
Maintain project tracking systems of subject and site information. * Participate in company and/or client required training programs.

EXPERIENCE REQUIRED

Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































































 Job Title




































 Tech Engineer- Immersive Technology
 





































 Job Description





































 What is the opportunity?
 The Immersive Tech lab in T+O is part of the Tech Innovation team, focused on understanding new technologies, promoting them across the organization and finding pilot use cases to build implementation momentum. We look at everything from VR work collaboration to 3D data visualization, VR training, phone and headset based AR experiences and Wearable glass.

 We are a very small hands on team (6 people), and the XR Engineer will play a key role in assessing, implementing and supporting these new technologies in the lab. This person will have a primary role in building, maintaining and running our lab experiences around the world.

 We are looking for a highly motivated person who has a passion for new tech and can continuously pick up new things, get them working and evangelize them to a wide audience.

 What will you do?

 Take new technologies that we want to assess, bring them in, get them working and form opinions on them. Sometimes this will be with other members of the team, sometimes on your own.
 Build working labs in multiple regions, including building relationships with people in some smaller regions to manage some kit remotely.
 Organize Lab demo days, exec briefings and other ways to get the broad RBC community to engage with the technology we are exploring.
 Be able to onboard tech that we move past initial stages into the RBC environment including getting software packaged, firewalls opened, security reviews done etc.
 Provide user support to early adopter user communities of technology that we start to roll out to production pilots.
 Provide training and hand offs to RBC IT groups as and when technology graduates into a fully supported service.
 Key input into what we do, what will work, and where we should prioritize our efforts.


 What do you need to succeed?
 Must have: 

Demonstrable technical curiosity and ability to inspire others with the potential of new tech
 Proven experience with implementing technology across a broad range of areas (5+ years)
 Some software development experience expected but more focused on scripting/integrations etc than full-on s/w engineering


 Proven support skills
 Highly organized. Able to operate with limited supervision in managing events, support, and multiple priorities
 Highly flexible attitude, as part of a small team with a rapidly changing pipeline of work, every day is interesting, but we can’t guarantee any particular tech / task
 Able to communicate with other technical teams to help promote the technology
 Able to work globally (team is across UK / Canada, internal client base is global)


 Nice-to-have

 AR/VR specific experience


 What’s in it for you?
 Continuously playing with very cool tech and innovation in a small dynamic global team. Ability to teach, inspire and amaze others with the potential of new immersive technology to make positive change!

 Overall at RBC we thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

 A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
 Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
 Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
 Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
 A world-class training program in financial services
 Flexible work/life balance options
 Opportunities to do challenging work

Date Posted: 08/31/2022 Req ID: 26907 Faculty/Division: Ofc of the Chief Information Officer Department: Information Security Campus: St. George (Downtown Toronto)

 Description:

 Under the general supervision of the Associate Director, Information Security Strategic Initiatives, the Manager, Information Security Risk Management is the University of Toronto lead for the University’s Information Risk program and responsible for identifying, escalating, and tracking information security risks to people, process, and technology.
 The incumbent is the leader of a team of information security and privacy professionals who conduct privacy and risk assessments for both in-house projects and third-party service providers. The team owns University-wide information risk management practices and tools as part of the University’s overall Risk Management strategy, including: (1) Threat/Risk Assessments (TRA), Privacy Impact Assessments (PIA) and Business Impact Assessments (BIA); (2) workshops and training material for users to consistently and transparently capture meaningful risk data; (3) a comprehensive cyber risk registry for the university; and (4) operational risk metrics and executive level risk reports.
 .
 The Manager, Information Security Risk Management leads analysis of complex projects or business practices to directly identify and mitigate privacy and security risks. They are responsible for escalating timely and emerging information risks to the university.

 The Manager has frequent interaction with all levels of the University community, including faculty, staff, and students, stakeholders in Academic divisions and departments, and institutional departments such as Human Resources, Research Services, Enrolment Services, Financial Services.

 Qualifications:

 EDUCATION:

 University degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

 EXPERIENCE:

 Ten-plus years working in an Information Technology environment. Five-plus years in a team lead or senior/supervisory role in an IT environment. Five-plus years working with Information Security as a prime focus of activity. Strong understanding of client and server application deployment and support. Strong understanding of client and server activity tracking. Experience in software / service deployment Strong understanding of IT Architecture concepts and security methodologies Experience auditing systems for compliance (PCI-DSS, PA-DSS, etc.) Experience developing information security standards and guidelines Expert knowledge of information security risk and risk mitigation concepts
 Extensive experience developing, using and evaluating risk assessment procedures such as questionnaires and survey

 SKILLS:

 Strong communication skills, both oral and written. Excellent staff management, project management, technical lead and facilitation skills Adept at conforming to shifting priorities, demands and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilities Ability to master new technology quickly Ability to quickly assess security incidents based on limited, often incomplete information. Strong understanding of change and configuration management processes.
 Excellent oral and written communication skills and ability to produce high-quality, comprehensive communications materials Ability to work both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment Strong ability to elicit cooperation and collaboration from a wide variety of sources, including upper management, stakeholders, and other departments Excellent conflict resolution skills with strong ability to exercise judgement, tact, discretion and determination Adept at conducting research into technical or project-related issues and products, to continually improve processes and solutions as technology changes Strong organization skills with the ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment

 OTHER:

 Both broad and in-depth knowledge of industry innovations and state-of-the-art technology in both computing and networking arenas. Strong organizational and interpersonal skills. Familiarity with financial requirements of project management a plus. IT Security certifications held or in progress a plus. Familiarity with database administration and operation a plus.
 Exposure to e-commerce and other net-centric business models highly desirable, as is experience with, and ability to provide support outside of normal working hours, as needed.
